params.name: limit
params.desc: Specifies maximum number of accidents to return in a single request.

params.name: page
params.desc: Used for result pagination; specifies a page to be returned. It should be combined with a number of accidents returned on the page that is specified by the limit parameter.

params.name: from
params.desc: Specifies the date from which accidents are meant to be returned.

params.name: to
params.desc: Specifies the date to which accidents are meant to be returned.

docs.title: GET api/:id
docs.description: Returns details for the specific accident.

params.name: id
params.desc: The id of the requested accident.

docs.title: GET /api/circle
docs.description: Returns accident in the specific radius for the given center (lat, lng).

params.name: limit
params.desc: Specifies maximum number of accidents to return in a single request.

params.name: page
params.desc: Used for result pagination; specifies a page to be returned. It should be combined with a number of accidents returned on the page that is specified by the limit parameter.

params.name: from
params.desc: Specifies the date from which accidents are meant to be returned.

params.name: to
params.desc: Specifies the date to which accidents are meant to be returned.

params.name: r
params.desc: Radius of a circle in meters.

params.name: lat
params.desc: Latitude of the radius center.

params.name: lng
params.desc: Longitude of the radius center.

params.name: analyze
params.desc: If true, it will consider from hour, to hour, weather summary and day of week into consideration in calculations.

params.name: d
params.desc: Day of week, represents a value from 0 to 6 (Monday to Sunday).

params.name: fromh
params.desc: Start hour in analysis, from 0 to 23. For example, 3 is the fourth hour in a day.

params.name: toh
params.desc: End hour in analysis, from 0 to 23. For example, 3 is the fourth hour in a day.

params.name: summary
params.desc: Weather summary for analysis.

docs.title: POST /api/path
docs.description: Returns array of accidents that are on the given path as POST parameter in array of lat lng coordinates.

params.name: path
params.desc: POST parameter, represents point of a path.

docs.title: GET /api/statistics/year
docs.description: Returns number of accidents by every year.

params.desc: The is no parameter for the specific endpoint

docs.title: GET /api/statistics/quarter
docs.description: Returns number of accidents by every quarter.

params.desc: The is no parameter for the specific endpoint

docs.title: GET /api/statistics/month
docs.description: Returns number of accidents by every month.

params.desc: The is no parameter for the specific endpoint

docs.title: GET /api/statistics/day
docs.description: Returns number of accidents by every day of week.

params.desc: The is no parameter for the specific endpoint

docs.title: GET /api/statistics/hour
docs.description: Returns number of accidents by every hour.

params.desc: The is no parameter for the specific endpoint

docs.title: GET /api/statistics/type
docs.description: Returns number of accidents by every type of accident.

params.desc: The is no parameter for the specific endpoint

docs.title: GET /api/statistics/weather
docs.description: Returns accidents for the all precipitation.

params.desc: The is no parameter for the specific endpoint

docs.title: GET /api/statistics/summary
docs.description: Returns number of accidents for every type od weather summary.

params.desc: The is no parameter for the specific endpoint

docs.title: GET /api/statistics/temperature
docs.description: Returns number of accidents for the given temperature interval.

params.name: tempStep
params.desc: Represents the size of an interval to count accidents by.

params.name: min
params.desc: Represents the start temperature to group by.

params.name: max
params.desc: Represents the end temperature to group by.

docs.title: GET /api/statistics/all
docs.description: Returns combined statistics for year, month, day, hour, quarter, type, weather and summary statistics.

params.desc: The is no parameter for the specific endpoint
